intro: Randia anisophylloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by red or orange berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
